result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chloe S Pettigrew

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chloe S Pettigrew in court.  Attorney Gabriel William Houghton in court for Chloe S Pettigrew.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
OFF THE RECORD: Court is in trial and there are no spin courts available to hear this case.  Parties notified of new court date by email.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Chloe S Pettigrew in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to follow Family Court order exactly as it is written. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. No new offenses that rise to the level of probable cause.

Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the Court. Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. The Court appointed Attorney Houghton to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour and defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month. Repayment to begin after the conclusion of the case on the 1st of the month and every month thereafter.

Defendant Chloe S Pettigrew in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton appearing as a friend of the Court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for initial appearance.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Chloe S Pettigrew
Current: 3803 W Dory Drive, Franklin, WI 53132   (Effective: 05-16-2022)
Prior: 4355 North 104th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/01/2022@2:30p
